title: Experimental Beauty Makes a Return at Paris Fashion Week
description: The hottest hair trend is not being able to see at all.
excerpt: The hottest hair trend is not being able to see at all. Check out ELLE.com's favorite beauty looks from the spring/summer 2025 Paris Fashion Week runways.
text: Pascal Le Segretain//Getty ImagesWith colder months fast approaching, we are bidding adieu to fashion month and archiving all those runway snaps that have been consuming our screenshot folder for weeks. And now, the eager anticipation of covetable beauty looks that will inevitably spawn future trends. The Paris shows especially stood out for pushing the boundaries of experimental beauty. Minimalist beauty will forever and always remain a classic, but the latest trends implore you to embrace the unconventional. For instance: why not consider bangs that completely cover your eyes?Ahead, peruse our favorite beauty looks from the Paris Fashion Week spring/summer 2025 runways that we, at ELLE, won’t shut up about. Bang, Bang!Victor Virgile//Getty Images Mugler’s spring/summer 2025 beauty look should come with a disclaimer: “Not for the faint of heart.” In line with the dark and moody theme of the collection, models (and Cardi B) sported sharp V-shaped bangs that covered both eyes and fell just slightly under the nose. If you were considering Sabrina Carpenter-esque bangs for a pre-spring makeover, but want something a little less Short n’ Sweet, Mugler’s take on curtain bangs is a grungy update for those who want to stand out.Sporty Spice SAVIKO//Getty ImagesWinter Arc this, 75 Strong that—as we inch closer to the end of the year, workouts are top of mind, including at Dior. The spring/summer 2025 presentation honored the strength of women in the form of smudgy liner, worn-in blush placed just under the cheekbone, and, of course, Dior double headbands. ELLE Editors’ October Prime Day PicksThat ’70s Wave Victor Virgile//Getty ImagesWaves are a fool-proof way of looking effortless without putting in any real work. At Chloe, the fluffy, cascading dresses were punctuated by flowing, loose waves that appeared air-dried but still polished. MetallicaVictor Virgile//Getty ImagesNew Year’s is a world away, but Loewe and Casablanca already have your holiday party looks covered. According to Casablanca, a simple silver lid won’t cut it; instead, brush the shade well above your lids and slightly into your brow arches for a dramatic, blown-out look. Victor Virgile//Getty ImagesFor a pared-down option that’s equally alluring, Loewe added extravagant silver graphic wings on the lids, stretching the end out past the tail of the brow. Vibrant VisionBERTRAND GUAY//Getty ImagesWith Halloween approaching, Dries van Noten presented a playful, eye-catching alternative to basic lash extensions: colorful lashes. Vibrant and neon-hued, they drew just the right amount of attention without overshadowing the colorful runway designs. Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture.
html:
With colder months fast approaching, we are bidding adieu to fashion month and archiving all those runway snaps that have been consuming our screenshot folder for weeks. And now, the eager anticipation of covetable beauty looks that will inevitably spawn future trends. The Paris shows especially stood out for pushing the boundaries of experimental beauty. Minimalist beauty will forever and always remain a classic, but the latest trends implore you to embrace the unconventional. For instance: why not consider bangs that completely cover your eyes?

Ahead, peruse our favorite beauty looks from the Paris Fashion Week spring/summer 2025 runways that we, at ELLE, won’t shut up about.

Bang, Bang!

Mugler’s spring/summer 2025 beauty look should come with a disclaimer: “Not for the faint of heart.” In line with the dark and moody theme of the collection, models (and Cardi B) sported sharp V-shaped bangs that covered both eyes and fell just slightly under the nose. If you were considering Sabrina Carpenter-esque bangs for a pre-spring makeover, but want something a little less Short n’ Sweet, Mugler’s take on curtain bangs is a grungy update for those who want to stand out.

Sporty Spice

Winter Arc this, 75 Strong that—as we inch closer to the end of the year, workouts are top of mind, including at Dior. The spring/summer 2025 presentation honored the strength of women in the form of smudgy liner, worn-in blush placed just under the cheekbone, and, of course, Dior double headbands.

ELLE Editors’ October Prime Day Picks

That ’70s Wave

Waves are a fool-proof way of looking effortless without putting in any real work. At Chloe, the fluffy, cascading dresses were punctuated by flowing, loose waves that appeared air-dried but still polished.

Metallica

New Year’s is a world away, but Loewe and Casablanca already have your holiday party looks covered. According to Casablanca, a simple silver lid won’t cut it; instead, brush the shade well above your lids and slightly into your brow arches for a dramatic, blown-out look.

For a pared-down option that’s equally alluring, Loewe added extravagant silver graphic wings on the lids, stretching the end out past the tail of the brow.

Vibrant Vision

With Halloween approaching, Dries van Noten presented a playful, eye-catching alternative to basic lash extensions: colorful lashes. Vibrant and neon-hued, they drew just the right amount of attention without overshadowing the colorful runway designs.

Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture.
